publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-4334 Stuart McMillan: European Pipe Band Championships Come to Greenock—That the Parliament welcomes the European Pipe Band Championships back to Battery Park in Greenock on 25 July 2009; recognises that Greenock was the place where many people emigrated from Scotland for a new life abroad so it is therefore fitting that this major event should be held in Inverclyde during the Year of Homecoming; notes that it is hoped that over 130 pipe bands from around the world will be coming to Greenock for the championships; further notes that the event will see a spectacular display by the Golden Lion Parachute Display Team as well as other family activities during the day, and wishes all taking part in the dancing, drum and piping competitions on the day well and the event great success. Supported by: Bill Kidd*, Kenneth Gibson*, Maureen Watt*, Jamie McGrigor*, Sandra White*, Stewart Maxwell*, Brian Adam*, John Wilson*

S3M-4334 Stuart McMillan: European Pipe Band Championships Come to Greenock—That the Parliament welcomes the European Pipe Band Championships back to Battery Park in Greenock on 25 July 2009; recognises that Greenock was the place from where many people emigrated from Scotland for a new life abroad so it is therefore fitting that this major event should be held in Inverclyde during the Year of Homecoming; notes that it is hoped that over 130 pipe bands from around the world will be coming to Greenock for the championships; further notes that the event will see a spectacular display by the Golden Lion Parachute Display Team as well as other family activities during the day, and wishes all taking part in the dancing, drum and piping competitions on the day well and the event great success. Supported by: Bill Kidd, Kenneth Gibson, Maureen Watt, Jamie McGrigor, Sandra White, Stewart Maxwell, Brian Adam, John Wilson, Dave Thompson*
